intro: Badusa palawanensis, commonly known as the Palawan badusa, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines, specifically found on the island of Palawan. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a glossy surface, while its flowers are usually white or pale pink. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
